title: Cabbie says woman let him grope her to spare the fare
text: Cabbie says woman let him grope her to spare the fare Ismail Sebugwaawo /Abu Dhabi Filed on February 12, 2017 Share Vote The Pakistani cabbie on Sunday appeared at the Abu Dhabi Criminal Court of First Instance A taxi driver, who is accused of inappropriately touching a female passenger, claimed at the court that the woman had allowed him to touch her, as she didn't have money to pay the taxi fare. The Pakistani cabbie on Sunday appeared at the Abu Dhabi Criminal Court of First Instance, charged with sexually assaulting the Filipina woman. Man grows marijuana in Abu Dhabi house, arrested The woman said she had chosen to sit in the back seat of the taxi while on her way to her accommodation located in the outskirts of Abu Dhabi city, but the driver asked her to sit in the front seat. And while on their way, the driver started staring at her. "The man then drove to a remote area and stopped on the road side," said the alleged victim, adding that then the man started groping her. The Filipina told the court that she managed to escape from the cabbie and got out of the car. She said she ran to her home and informed the police, who later arrested the taxi driver. Intoxicated worker stabs roommate to death in Abu Dhabi At the court, the accused denied molesting the woman stressing that he touched her with her consent when the woman said she was unable to pay him the taxi charge. "She hired the taxi to go home. But after reaching her destination, I asked her to pay the taxi fare and she said she didn't have any money. "She then told me that I could do anything to her to spare her from paying the money." The man told the court that he was surprised when the police later arrested him over the woman's complaint. The trial has been adjourned to February 28. ismail@khaleejtimes.com
